intro: Taraxacum roseiflos, commonly known as the rose-flowered dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its rosette of basal leaves and a single, upright stem that terminates in a yellow flower head. The plant produces a distinctive seed dispersal mechanism known as a pappus, which aids in wind pollination. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in meadows, lawns, and disturbed soils. Taraxacum roseiflos is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
